summary: An email from July 3, 2008, discussing a lawyer representing three victims who wants to potentially exit the non-prosecution agreement, and detailing a meeting with the Sheriff's Office about Jeffrey Epstein's jail conditions, work release eligibility, and false educational claims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the non-prosecution agreement and incarceration; described as being in the stockade, eligible for work release, and falsely claiming advanced education.

persons.name: Ken Starr
persons.context: Referenced as part of a legal team that would sue if Epstein received less favorable treatment in jail.

persons.name: Goldberger
persons.context: Mentioned as having met with Epstein at the jail along with a psychiatrist.

connections.description: Ken Starr is implied to be part of Epstein's legal defense team, threatening litigation over jail conditions.
Goldberger met with Epstein at the jail, suggesting a legal or advisory role.

events.title: Victims' Lawyer Inquiry on NPA
events.description: A lawyer representing three victims contacts the office to ask if they can get out of the non-prosecution agreement with Epstein, and requests consultation if Epstein hesitates to complete his obligations.

events.title: Meeting with Sheriff's Office on Jail Conditions
events.description: A meeting occurred with the Sheriff's Office discussing Epstein's incarceration at the stockade, his eligibility for work release, and threats of lawsuit from his legal team over treatment.

locations: stockade (implied to be in Broward County)
keyFacts: A lawyer representing three Epstein victims inquired about exiting the non-prosecution agreement, indicating victims could name many more victims.
Epstein was held at a stockade, not the main jail, and was deemed eligible for work releaseâ€”contradicting prior statements to agents.
Epstein's legal team, including Ken Starr, threatened to sue if he received less favorable treatment than other inmates.
Epstein falsely claimed to have at least a master's degree; in reality, he only had a high school diploma and some college courses, making him ineligible to teach GED classes.
The email reveals internal skepticism about Epstein's 'brilliant' reputation and his fabricated educational background.
